turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Who's controlling your mind?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Whoa!... The government. They control everybody's mind. You're too fucking stupid to know that?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: This has nothing to do with Walter.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: They want Walter dead!

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Tell me what's wrong.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Particles, man. I feel them all the time. I feel them in my arms and legs man, that's how they punish me.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: How can I help you with the particles?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: It's not just the particles man, it's the whole fucking machine, this is how they get assassins to operate. It's been this way since the cuban missile crisis.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: They have less power over you if you look into my eyes.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Tell my dad.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Tell him what, what do you want me to tell him?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Tell my dad I'm sorry about the watch.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I'll tell him. Where does he live. We'll get him on the phone right now.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: I hate fucking Springfield.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Is that where you're family lives?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Where's the car?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I need to get something straight first.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It's my job to see that no one gets killed, Earl... Including you.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Then where's my FUCKING car!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Absolutely. Bank robbers are generally your smartest criminals.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: The Old Guy? What kind of show of faith is that? I want Debbie.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Am I gettin' the car?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You're gettin' the car.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You want a convertible or hardtop?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Manual or automatic?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Automatic.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: JAIL GUARD #2
turns.text: Who are you again?

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Johnny Hawkins. Bail Bonds. I gotta be over at county in fifteen minutes, alright?

turns.speaker: JAIL GUARD #2
turns.text: Johnny who?

turns.speaker: JAIL GUARD #2
turns.text: Hold on a second here.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Is there a problem?

turns.speaker: JAIL GUARD #2
turns.text: You signed out twice.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: I what?

turns.speaker: JAIL GUARD #2
turns.text: Look, why don't you just come on back inside for a second.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Wait a minute, lemme see that.

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Hi, Roper.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Hi, Kimura. Where's the command post?

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: The suspect came in shortly after the bank opened. Botched robbery. A teller hit the silent alarm. He took seven hostages. Shot one -- the guard. He's still alive. So far he's asked for...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: ...a car.

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: That's right, and a plane waiting at the airport. If he doesn't...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: ...get 'em, he's going to start shooting hostages in five minutes...

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What's the suspect's name?

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Earl.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: We got a guy who's probably on drugs. He's got a record of 459's and he was busted on possession. But he's never been busted on a major felony. What's his demeanor?

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Well he's a little fucking agitated -- he ripped the phone out.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I have to go face to face.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Anything on Korda so far?

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Solis said to keep you clear of this.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What do you got on Korda?

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: We ran a search on relatives. He has a cousin in town -- Clarence Teal. Smalltime thief. Last known address was on Pine Street. He moved out a month ago. We've got a couple leads on him to check out.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Did you check out DMV for any vehicles registration?

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Being faxed over now.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: How about the record room for any incident reports? He might be a victim. We can get medical records. Check with burglary detail and see if anyone else knows him, knows his habits.

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Roper...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: And what about bars? We can talk to neighbors to see what bars he frequents.

turns.speaker: KIMURA
turns.text: Roper, we're into it...

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: You don't have to come here.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yes, I do. That way there's no misunderstandings. I need to make sure no one's hurt, then we can take care of business.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Alright, Roper. You want to come... come.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Good. I won't be armed. We gotta operate on trust here. We're going to wrap this up and have you guys out of here as soon as possible.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Are you in charge, Roper?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: I want a car. Like a four wheel drive. I want it in perfect condition. I want a uniformed cop to drive it up right here. I want him to leave the engine running and walk to the end of the street. Then we'll come out. I don't want any remote control devices in it. I know all the tricks. If it's not in perfect condition, and I mean if its even low on wiper fluid, I'm going to kill somebody and we're gonna start again.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: I want a plane waiting at the airport. I'll tell them where I want to go when I get there.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Is that all?

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: For now that's all.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You'll get it. But, Joe, I want you to do something for me. Let me take a look around inside. Make sure everybody's okay.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: No. You just do shit for me right now.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Joe, I'm doing a lot for you. I think you could give me something to cement the deal... One hostage.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: I'll give you something.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: You can't kill me like this.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What if you and me got into a struggle... and my gun went off?

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Open your shirt.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I'm not wearing a wire. This is just between you and me.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Shut the fuck up and do what I say!

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Satisfied?

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Open the bag, dump everything on the table.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It's all there.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: Spread it out.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: I'm impressed. I didn't think you could do it. What did you have to do, steal them?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KORDA
turns.text: That's not going to look too good on your service record.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I'll worry about that. Let's get on with it.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Same here. I've watched you in action. Very impressive.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You've got a lot of hard work ahead of you if you want to be a negotiator.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I'm ready to do it.  And I'm going to be here more than two weeks.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Don't go reading my lips, man. That's an intrusion. Save that shit for the sniper school. Comprende?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Sorry... Habit.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: We're already past it, aren't we, Kevin?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You ever been in a hostage situation?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Only at the very end.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: How do you feel after a shooting.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Like it had to be done.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It rarely has to be done.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I've rarely shot anyone.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: SWAT is a lifesaving unit, you know.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Try to remember that.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: What's the point of this?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: A little exercise in lateral thinking. The obvious solution isn't always the only solution... See you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I'm sorry about your friend. I had a friend in SWAT killed. I know how it can be.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I appreciate your concern. Let's leave it at that.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: So, McCall, how come you ended up in San Francisco?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: They recruited me. Promised me fast advancement.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Recruited you from where?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: National Marksman Competition.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: With your qualifications you must have had a lot of offers. Why here?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Furthest point I could find from New York.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You don't like New York?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Spent my whole life there. I just wanted to get out for a while.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You'd never been out of New York?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Been to Toronto. My mother was born there.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: How did you like Toronto?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: It was okay.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You're a real excitable sort, aren't you?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: You caught me on an "up" day.  How about you? How did you end up in San Francisco?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I grew up in Oakland... Crossed the Bay Bridge and here I was.  So you're looking for "fast advancement".

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Is there something wrong with that?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: How are we gonna get him out of there?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: We could fill it with water.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Eighty-five percent of domestic disturbances of this nature end in murder/suicide.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Not the ones I'm at.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Come on. Let's go for a drink.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I don't really like to drink.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You have to. It's a tradition.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Well, if I have to, I have to.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You got a girlfriend?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Why? You like my ass?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You wouldn't want to put a small wager on this, would you?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I don't gamble.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Yeah, I've got a girlfriend.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You living together?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: She's back in Jersey... going to graduate school.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Explain how that works.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: She's going to come here when she graduates and then we're gonna get married.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: She grow up in Livingtston, too?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: No, no, no...  She's from Hoboken.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Oh, "city girl". Don't you ever long for companionship with her such a long way away in New Jersey?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: We see each other every couple of months.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Every couple of months, huh?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: That's a lot of commitment. I admire that.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Do you really?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: No. Actually I think it's fucking crazy, I don't know if I could do it.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Thanks for clearing that up.  I hear your former girlfriend is going out with Greg Barnett.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Where did you hear that?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Around. Barnett's tough competition.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yeah, well that's a sore subject, and therefore out of bounds to a young sprout of a hostage negotiator under my tutelage.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Lesson two, "Dead Eye"... should have been lesson one. Never exchange yourself for a hostage.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I think I can handle that one.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yeah, you think so, but it comes up.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You think you can learn, McCall?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: First things is, don't say, "What's going on?" Everybody knows what's going on. I come into this situation, I say,  "I'm glad to see nobody's hurt. That's good. I'm here to help you."  Second: You hesitated. Don't hesitate. If you're thinking, talk while you're thinking, or else he's going to think you're plotting. Which you are. If he thinks you're plotting, you're going to make him nervous. You don't want him nervous. Got that?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It'll come. Try again.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Tell me what you need.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I need you to bring me the scumbag who ran off with my wife so I can cut off his nuts.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I can't do that.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Then get out of my face you worthless piece of frogshit.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Nah, I just throw that in because I enjoy it.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: So what do I say to this guy?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You could say something like,  "Tell me what the scumbag's name is. Maybe we can work something out."

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: What? Bring somebody in so he can cut his nuts off?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: If you want to be a successful negotiator, you've got to learn to lie.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I'm not good at lying.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Get good at it.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: It's against my nature.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You know the ten commandments?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What's the first commandment?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Thou shall have no other God before me.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: You tell me.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Thou shall not kill... You've killed, right?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: To save lives.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: So why would you hesitate to lie to save lives?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: My name's McCall. I'm unarmed.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Okay, stop.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What did you see?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: A dirtbag behind the counter holding a sawed-off. A Berretta nine millimeter in his belt. A female hostage, red dress, on the floor in front of the cereal display. Male hostage, jeans and blue checked shirt, three feet to her right. Another male hostage, white pants, green shirt, Nikes, laying in front of the magazine rack. A female dirtbag with a gun under her shirt, sitting against the beer cooler, trying to pass herself off as a hostage, and there's a special on toilet-paper, four for a buck twenty-nine.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Why did he do it?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Because he knew the little girl had zero chance of survival and his chances would be a little better... We had a plan, but SWAT opened up too early. He got caught in the crossfire.  Let's move on... Notice this. Always use the eyes to keep the connection. It almost like hypnosis. That's the most important thing. Create a connection. You're always on their side...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You know why I like the track?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: You're a compulsive gambler?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: See the favorite? Tail up. Washy. He doesn't want to run today. Cross him off... Now the Six looks good. On his toes. Coat shiny. This trainer/jockey combo does well. We can't leave him out.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I have two words for you... Seek help.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I have three words for you... Ex-ac- ta.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I bought you a four-six exacta box. You owe me twenty bucks.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: We need the 4 and 6 to finish to first and second.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Ronnie... Yeah, so.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Now she's going out with Greg Barnett?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: So what do you want?... An autograph.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I don't know why she'd pick him over you.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I'm just practicing my lying.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Still needs work.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: You're right. I'll never be as good a liar as you.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: The 6 horse is last.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: That's okay. That's his style.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: To run last?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: To run late!

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: The 6 horse is still last.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: He'll be running at the quarter pole.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: They need to run first and second?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Yeah, first and second.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: COME ON RUSSELL!...  Who the fuck's Russell?!

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: The jockey!

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: COME ON, RUSSELL!

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: We won!

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: We lost.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: We won.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: How much you wanna bet?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: You want to bet on whether you won your bet? This is getting sick.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: How long you been coming here?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: About six years. My partner took me.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Is it always like this?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Occasionally you lose.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: See this. Solis has me driving the shit-mobile, and he picked this up straight out of impound for fourteen grand. Probably worth thirty.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Police corruption. It's everywhere.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: There's your answer. He's smart.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: He's cutting down the visibility.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: And doing a very good job of it.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: He's got the girl.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Damnit!

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: What the fuck is going on.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I don't know, but I've got to get on there.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Pull up alongside.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It might have happened no matter who was up there.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Bullshit! Would it have happened to you?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Maybe... There's one thing you have to remember... You don't create the situations. You can only try to save people from them.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I thought I could do it. I was so damn sure of myself. But I didn't know what to say. The words wouldn't come. My mouth turned to mush. You make it look so easy, Roper. But it is not. It's not easy.  It's a different job than looking through the rifle scope.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: That it is.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: How many have you lost?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I look at it as how many I've saved. That's the way you've got to look at it.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: And what about the ones you don't save?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You live with it... and they haunt you. It doesn't leave.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: And what if you can't live with it?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You've got to decide that for yourself.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: He's gonna kill her no matter what. If I take him these jewels he's gonna kill me and her.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: So what do you want to do?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: That's a chance I gotta take.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Then we better get moving... But there's no way we can get the jewels out of evidence.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Mare Island is an abandoned shipyard, cranes, high buildings... he'll be in place where he can see everything.  How are we going to get me in there?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Good question.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: McCall, you all right?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I'm okay. Korda... went down the side of the building...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Stay put.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Roper. Metro Division. Hostage Negotiator. Give me the short version.

turns.speaker: OFFICER #1
turns.text: Husband came home. Found that guy and his wife "in flagrante". Now he's holding her at knife point.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Which apartment?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Have you evacuated anyone?

turns.speaker: OFFICER #1
turns.text: Only that floor.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Is the hostage injured?

turns.speaker: OFFICER #1
turns.text: Don't know. She keeps screaming to stay out. He keeps screaming to stay out. We decided to stay out.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Well, there's a good amount of agreement on that.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I know how you feel, Ray.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: You don't know shit, and I suggest you leave.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I can't leave, Ray. It's part of my negotiator's oath. Once I'm in the room with the hostage, I have to stay.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: You don't want to see what I'm going to do to her.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Let me show you something, Ray.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Same thing happened to me, man. She cheated on me, but I forgave her. You know why?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I ain't interested in your life story.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Because I was partially to blame. I wasn't around as much as I should have been. I forgot how to love her.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: She's the one to blame. Not me.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Ray, think about how she looked when you married her. Think about how happy you were. Don't lose that, man. Don't give up everything.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: What am I giving up? I'm laid off last year. I'm down to my last unemployment check. I'm out on the streets looking for work and this bitch is banging some asshole in my bed.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Ray, if you walk out of here with me, I'll get you a job.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Doing what? Cleaning toilets?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I can't guarantee you what it will be. But I swear on my life, I'll find you work.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: And why the fuck would you do that for me?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Not for you, Ray. For me. A close friend of mine was killed this week. The way I figure it, I stop you from doin' what you said, I'm one up on body count.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Who the fuck are you, Mother Teresa?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: My name's Scott Roper.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: This baseball player you're going out with...  He's no good for you.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Really?! He's a wonderful guy. He makes two million a year, and he worships me.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I worship you.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You worship yourself.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Ronnie, forget this what's-his-name.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Greg.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Did you know he's already got a bad knee? In another 10 years you're going to be pushing him around in a wheelchair.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You know what I think? I think you only want me now, because I'm with somebody else.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Who cares what you think. I want you back and that's all that matters.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Let me take you out tomorrow night... Pleeease.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: I'm going out with Greg tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: This Greg is really getting in my way.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Please. I'm begging you.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Oh, I've got to get a shot of this.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Hey yourself. Came by to see Troy.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: A little late for that, Scottie. He's asleep.  Jack Daniels?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I'm not drunk. Yet.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Maybe you should be.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You heard.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yeah. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: That a new picture?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: About 4 months old. I'm working in a new style.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I won't stay long. I had to talk to someone.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You don't usually talk to anyone when you're hurting.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It was my fault. I was right downstairs. I should have gone up with him.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Scott, You can't save everyone.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I've proved that, didn't I?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Oh, hell, forget it. This won't work.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Something I guess I can't have anymore.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Don't try to make me feel guilty. The whole time we were together, you went out of your way to prove you didn't need me. Now, suddenly, for one night, you need me again. I can't do it. I can't be more than your friend. Because I know what will happen. In a few weeks you'll be back on top, and you'll shut me out just as soon as you don't need me again.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: You think I didn't need you?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: If you did, you never showed it.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Ronnie...

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I wanted to get this out of the way.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: You got a bet on the game tonight?

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: As a matter of fact, I do.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: It's already started.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I was going to catch the last half on TV.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: That kind with the garlic and the oil that I like so much?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: No. The kind from Kraft, with the macaroni and the cheese.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: I've been craving that stuff all week.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: And it's hard to get.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Mmm, needs a little something.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What are you talking about? This is it. This is the stuff right here.  Well, maybe just a pinch more sugar.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Yeah that's it.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Why don't you just stick your finger in and stir it up.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Scottie...

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Scottie, remember the day you lost that hostage in union square. You came over that night and we made mad, crazy love. But I didn't even know what happened... 'til I heard it on the news the next morning.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: It's because I wanted to keep you away from that world.

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: It's not that world. It's your world. It's part of who you are.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: Veronica, it's not easy for me... I don't know if I can change overnight. But what I'm telling you is that I want to share everything with you, because I don't ever want to be without you again.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: What about Greg? What are you gonna tell him?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: It's okay. We broke up.

turns.speaker: ROPER
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: RONNIE
turns.text: Just now.
